title: How to Make a Carnation from a Plastic Egg Carton

"} Separate and cut each cup from a plastic egg carton.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/7/7b/Ep3_151.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/7/7b/Ep3_151.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":412,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":680.96,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"}
steps.description: Cut each cup into quarters to make petals, and press the shape flat to open it up.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/7/7a/Ep4_858.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/7/7a/Ep4_858.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":346,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":571.52,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"}
steps.description: Cut the end of each petal with pinking shears to make a zigzag edge.

steps.headline: Make several more sets of petals in the same way.

{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/f/fa/Ep6_738.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/f/fa/Ep6_738.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":346,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":571.52,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"}
steps.description: Make a hole in the center by a pressing a pin through from the inside.

steps.headline: Make a Wire from a Plastic Bottle.
steps.description: Melt one end into a ball bigger than the pinhole made in the previous step. Use the fire of a lighter to make the ball. Sharpen the other end with a pair of scissors. (An example of the nylon material) In case of a PET is sparkling, and becomes black.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/f/fe/Ep7_968.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/f/fe/Ep7_968.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":346,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":571.52,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"}
steps.description: Put the wire through the pinhole to hold the petal.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/9/9e/Pet_778.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/9/9e/Pet_778.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":346,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":571.52,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"}
steps.description: Cut a plastic bottle into the shape shown. Use the plastic bottle to hold and shape each layer of petals with heat from a hair dryer or heat gun.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/3/3c/Ep8_666.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/3/3c/Ep8_666.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":346,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":571.52,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"}
steps.description: Repeat the shaping process for all of the petals.

steps.headline: Preview the shape of the assembled flower by stacking the layers of petals together.
Make the accent color by drawing it on the outside with a permanent marker.

{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/b/bf/St1_690.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/b/bf/St1_690.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":614,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":1014.6,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"}
steps.description:
{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/a/aa/St_360.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/a/aa/St_360.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} Cut several short segments of a drinking straw.

steps.headline: String the petals together on the wire with straws in between to separate them, as shown.
steps.description: You can slit the sides of the straws to make stringing easier.

steps.headline: Hang this string and spray paint the outsides (tops) of the petals a lighter pink.
steps.description: You should have, in order, plastic egg carton, permanent marker, and spray paint.

steps.headline: When the paint has dried, remove the straws and tighten the flower together.
steps.description: Put hot glue between the layers to hold them together if you need to.

steps.headline: Attach the flower to a basket or box.

tyn: Egg pack (polyethylene terephthalate (PETE) or other clear plastic)
Soda bottle (The parts to fix at the back are made.)
Glue for plastics or hot glue
Hair dryer or heat air gun

"} Cut several short segments of a drinking straw. String the petals together on the wire with straws in between to separate them, as shown. You can slit the sides of the straws to make stringing easier. Hang this string and spray paint the outsides (tops) of the petals a lighter pink. You should have, in order, plastic egg carton, permanent marker, and spray paint. When the paint has dried, remove the straws and tighten the flower together. Put hot glue between the layers to hold them together if you need to. Attach the flower to a basket or box.

"} Make a hole in the center by a pressing a pin through from the inside.
Make a Wire from a Plastic Bottle.
Melt one end into a ball bigger than the pinhole made in the previous step.
Use the fire of a lighter to make the ball.
Sharpen the other end with a pair of scissors.
(An example of the nylon material) In case of a PET is sparkling, and becomes black.

{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/f/fe/Ep7_968.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/f/fe/Ep7_968.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":346,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":571.52,"licensing":"

Use the plastic bottle to hold and shape each layer of petals with heat from a hair dryer or heat gun.

{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/3/3c/Ep8_666.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/3/3c/Ep8_666.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":346,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":571.52,"licensing":"

"} Repeat the shaping process for all of the petals.
Preview the shape of the assembled flower by stacking the layers of petals together.
Make the accent color by drawing it on the outside with a permanent marker.

{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/b/bf/St1_690.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/b/bf/St1_690.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":614,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":1014.6,"licensing":"

"} Cut several short segments of a drinking straw.
String the petals together on the wire with straws in between to separate them, as shown.
You can slit the sides of the straws to make stringing easier.
Hang this string and spray paint the outsides (tops) of the petals a lighter pink.
You should have, in order, plastic egg carton, permanent marker, and spray paint.
When the paint has dried, remove the straws and tighten the flower together.
Put hot glue between the layers to hold them together if you need to.
Attach the flower to a basket or box.
